oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Centennial celebrations; Exhibitions; Anniversaries; Commemorations; Events; Festivals; Fairs; Exhibition buildings
Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition (1897 : Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of the History Building at the Tennessee Centennial Exposition. Shows the six majestic columns at the front of the building.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wiles, Marvin Willard, ca. 1883-1957
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The History Building was divided into five compartments. The central and largest room was set apart for History and Antiquities; another room was for the use of the Confederate Veterans; one room for the Grand Army of the Republic; one for the Colonial Dames and Daughters of the American Revolution; and the last room was for miscellaneous purposes. The History Building stood near the Parthenon.
